channel.title: pickle on Get Stuffed
channel.description: Recent content in pickle on Get Stuffed

item.title: Kimchi
item.description: Kimchi Little known outside Korea until relatively recently, this fiery fermented cabbage has taken the world by storm. Used more like a condiment than a side dish in its homeland, a little spicy cabbage peps up no end of dishes – plus it’s surprisingly easy to make and keeps for months. Which might just come in useful. Prep 25 min, plus salting time Cook None, but allow at least 5 days to ferment Makes 1 x 1-litre jar

item.title: Brussels Sprouts Kimchi
item.description: How-to-turn-excess-sprouts-into-kimchi-recipe-zero-waste-cooking Makes 2 x 500g jars 500g brussels sprouts, and/or other greens 250g mixed seasonal vegetables (eg, carrots, jerusalem artichokes, squash, turnip, kohlrabi) 100g dark green leek tops or spring onions Sea salt 4 tbsp brown rice, or white rice flour, gluten-free flour or wheat flour 6 garlic cloves, peeled 1 small red or white onion, peeled 4 tbsp gochujang, or Korean chilli powder or red chilli flakes 50ml fish sauce
